item.title: Benin President Patrice Talon says coup attempt thwarted with help from Nigerian military
item.description: Patrice Talon says the West African nation's government will punish those responsible for a coup attempt.

item.title: Cleveland Dodd's care in Unit 18 'inhumane', coroner examining youth detention death finds
item.description: Western Australia's first recorded death in youth detention was predictable, a coroner finds, declaring the care of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd was "inhumane" and "reminiscent of 19th century jails". WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

item.title: Water leak at the Louvre museum damages hundreds of works
item.description: The leak occurred after a valve was accidentally opened in a heating and ventilation system, allowing water to seep through the ceiling of the Mollien wing.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce joins One Nation, concluding defection from Nationals
item.description: Barnaby Joyce's defection gives One Nation its first lower house seat since 1998.

item.title: England's lack of Ashes depth highlighted as Australia A thumps Lions at Allan Border Field
item.description: England's lack of Test depth is highlighted as Australia A beats the Lions by an innings and 127 runs.

item.title: Government will not extend energy bill relief
item.description: Jim Chalmers says the end to the "temporary" subsidy was a "hard" decision but recognises pressures on the budget.

item.title: Thailand launches air strikes amid new border clashes with Cambodia
item.description: Thailand launches air strikes along its disputed border with Cambodia, after both countries accuse one another of breaching a ceasefire agreement brokered by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: One of PNG's rare conjoined twins dies after urgent surgery in Sydney, brother survives
item.description: Surgeons have separated a rare set of conjoined twins after they were urgently flown from Papua New Guinea to Australia, but only one of the boys has survived.

item.title: Coalition puts heat on Wells over trips to cricket and AFL with family
item.description: The Coalition is applying more heat to Sport Minister Anika Wells over flights she claimed for herself and her husband to attend two Boxing Day cricket test matches in recent years, and several AFL Grand Final events.

item.title: Toddler's septic tank death 'likely would have been prevented' with sufficient NT government maintenance
item.description: A coroner's report has found there were multiple missed opportunities to improve or replace the public housing septic system, which the NT government had responsibility for.

item.title: Australian Ashes openers Travis Head and Jake Weatherald praised as Usman Khawaja call looms
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne says Australia's opening partnership is making the rest of the batting order improve, as selectors deliberate over Usman Khawaja's Test future.

item.title: Should you go screen-free after giving birth? These mums share their stories
item.description: Readers share how they approached their online and social media use in the weeks immediately after giving birth.

item.title: Trump hosts Kennedy Center Honors in historic first
item.description: Donald Trump has made the Kennedy Center a touchstone in a broader attack against what he claims is "woke", anti-American culture.

item.title: More than 30 zinc sunscreen brands using formula that failed preliminary SPF testing
item.description: It's been almost two years since Craig Jones first ran preliminary tests on his zinc sunscreen. When he discovered it wasn't providing the SPF it was supposed to he threw it out and set out on a quest to find out why.

item.title: NRL proposes lengthy bans for Tonga officials following Eli Katoa head knocks
item.description: Three Tonga team officials are facing two-year suspensions following the NRL's investigation into the incident that forced Eli Katoa out of the 2026 season.

item.title: Nant whisky founder Keith Batt pleads not guilty over alleged fraud
item.description: The founder of a Tasmanian distillery behind an alleged investor fraud scheme has pleaded not guilty to 736 criminal offences.

item.title: Perth boy's death in Department of Communities care may have been accidental, inquest told
item.description: An inquest hears the 2024 death of a 10-year-old Indigenous boy while he was under the care of the Department of Communities may have been an accident, not suicide.

item.title: Clermont's only GP clinic closes after hospital doctor suspended
item.description: The suspension of Tim Lane leaves a Central Queensland town of 3,000 people with no permanent hospital doctor or GP.

item.title: Thailand-Cambodia border conflict reignites.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Renters need $300,000 more superannuation in retirement than home owners, report finds
item.description: Rising rents mean older Australians who are not home owners will need twice as much superannuation to enjoy the same retirement lifestyle as those who are mortgage-free, according to a study by a leading advocacy group.

item.title: Magnitude-7.6 earthquake in Japan prompts tsunami warning and evacuation order for 90,000 people
item.description: The quake has seen a tsunami warning issued for large parts of Japan's northern coastline and about 90,000 people ordered to evacuate to higher ground.

item.title: Jacob Elordi, Rose Byrne and Joel Edgerton score Golden Globes nominations
item.description: Jacob Elordi is Australia's big hope at the Golden Globes after scoring two nominations overnight for the 83rd iteration of the film and television awards.

item.title: Today in History, December 9: How smallpox was eradicated after killing 300 million people in the 20th century
item.description: The eradication of smallpox 46 years ago has been hailed as the greatest triumph of global public health. It has also been held up as a model for global cooperation.

item.title: Australia's favourite political test depends on who is at the pub
item.description: The "pub test" tends to be applied when we've run out of avenues to pursue a public figure, but are still super annoyed.

item.title: For some teenagers, 'life is better' without social media and they support the ban
item.description: Patrick, 15, does not use social media and hopes he never does. Nick, 15, had a flip phone for the first few years of high school. Here is why they support the social media ban.

item.title: Fluke discoveries of asbestos in children's sand strike twice decades apart
item.description: A doctor in the US who found asbestos in his son's sandpit tried in vain to get stronger regulations. Almost 40 years later he says he's "not surprised" the problem re-emerged in Australia.

item.title: A logical gas exports policy could put the economy back on an even keel
item.description: For a decade, a disaster has unfolded. We've run short of gas through indecision and incompetence, and that's driving energy costs and inflation. We need a solution and an unlikely source may have one.

item.title: Wells spends thousands on Comcars to attend grand finals, but has plenty of company
item.description: The sports minister has endured scrutiny over her use of parliamentary expenses, but is one of dozens of MPs to have accumulated large Comcar bills.

item.description: Halfbrick Studios, the company behind Fruit Ninja, has created the first ever Bluey video game made in Australia.

item.description: European leaders express scepticism about US-led plans to end Russia's invasion, following peace talks between US and Ukrainian officials end without a breakthrough.

item.title: Penny Wong and Richard Marles meet US counterparts in Washington after AUKUS review
item.description: The recommendations made by the US's recent review of the AUKUS pact remain confidential after the talks in Washington, where the two nations have committed to the continued growth of the American military presence in Australia.

item.description: The Victorian government makes a historic apology to Aboriginal Victorians, in one of the first public acts to follow the signing of the state's treaty agreement.

item.description: The offer paves the way for a battle between Paramount — whose owner, Larry Ellison, is an ally of Donald Trump — and streaming behemoth Netflix to buy one of Hollywood's most storied studios.

item.description: Farmers and businesses on the Mid North Coast are reeling after a fire tore through the region, destroying homes and forcing families to evacuate.

item.description: Mitch Marsh tells his Western Australia teammates he is retiring, but keeps the door ajar for a Test recall.

item.description: The sensational shutdown of the luxury caravan manufacturer has had a gut-wrenching impact on families from Australia and abroad.

item.description: Telcos and government staffers have been questioned about who knew what and when, after a second Triple Zero failure was linked to a possible death.

item.description: Fuels produced from waste and agricultural feedstock are tipped to play a role in cutting emissions, but a leading Victorian farmer says political will is required to seize the opportunity.

item.title: Farmsafe Australia issues warning after two serious hay bale incidents
item.description: A woman has died and a man has been hospitalised in two separate incidents involving falling hay bales in southern Queensland. Farm safety advocates are calling for increased caution while manoeuvring hay bales.

item.description: The announcement from NT police follows a months-long ABC investigation into the disappearance of a Yolŋu clan leader who vanished without a trace after being acquitted of murdering a police officer.

item.title: Alex de Minaur wins fourth Newcombe Medal as Maya Joint finishes runner-up
item.description: Alex de Minaur wins the Newcombe Medal for a fourth time, as Cruz Hewitt claims a junior award at Australian tennis's night of nights.

item.description: We've rounded up some Australian Christmas carols to enhance your festive mood, from W.G. James to Christine Anu.

item.description: Luke Eastman's interpretation work using Auslan in the band Alter Boy is recognised in this year's WA Music Awards, with a nomination for vocalist of the year.

item.description: Emergency services are searching for a man in Coffin Bay on the state's Eyre Peninsula after the alarm was raised about 1am on Tuesday.

item.description: The WA government has been sent yet another warning over the death of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd, who was held in conditions a coroner has compared to "19th century jails". History will show if lessons have been learnt. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

item.title: Jake Weatherald and Ben Stokes caught up in Ashes sledging after Jofra Archer and Steve Smith clash
item.description: Sledging between Jake Weatherald and Ben Stokes emerges after Jofra Archer and Steve Smith's fiery clash at the Gabba.

item.description: The WA government says it will continue to cap airfares for regional residents but from July next year they will be more expensive during peak holiday periods.

item.description: TPG Telecom chief executive Iñaki Berroeta flags another death possibly linked to a customer's inability to call Triple Zero (000) on their Samsung mobile phone.

item.description: Peter Jackson's life wouldn't be the same after that red carpet event on December 10, 2001, but it's fair to say cinema, and New Zealand, wouldn't be the same either.

item.description: Lamar Ahchee was arrested in Bali in May after Indonesian police tracked the delivery of two packages containing cocaine to his apartment.

item.title: Penalties push for financial abusers who draw partners into tax and company fraud
item.description: Perpetrators of financial abuse commit fraud by impersonating their partners, making them company directors in secret and putting business and tax debts in their names. The government wants to fix the problem, but will its proposed reforms go far enough?

item.description: Australia has more than 250 data centres and more in the pipeline, prompting experts to warn against using drinking water to cool servers.

item.description: Soaring costs and trenchant criticism from some put the brakes on wind and transmission as the sun shines on big solar and batteries.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Crucial koala corridors are dwindling in Sydney's south-west, conservationists warn
item.description: Key wildlife links between two of Sydney's major rivers are under threat from land clearing for housing, according to a koala conservation group.

item.title: What we know about the balloons disrupting air traffic in Lithuania
item.description: The balloons have been causing disruptions with air traffic since October. Here's what we know.

item.title: Mother whose son died after deliberately-lit house fire in Sydney says 'life is precious'
item.description: The mother of a teenager who was killed in a deliberately-lit house fire has told a Sydney court her son taught her "life is so precious" and she longed to be with him again for the rest of her days.

item.title: AI to be trialled at Royal Perth Hospital in bid to reduce pressure on WA health system
item.description: A trial of artificial intelligence at Royal Perth Hospital is announced in an attempt to help health workers focus on patient care, as new data reveals WA's emergency departments are among the most stretched in the nation.

item.title: Timor-Leste remembers Indonesian invasion 50 years after military assault
item.description: Survivors still have clear memories of the invasion by Indonesia, as Timor-Leste this week commemorates the beginning of a brutal 24-year occupation.

item.title: Star-studded cast of James Cameron's third Avatar film on what makes the movie series so special
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Taliban arrests young men in Afghanistan for Peaky Blinders dress-up
item.description: Morality police in Afghanistan detain several influencers who have gone viral for dressing up as 1920s gangsters in the style of BBC series Peaky Blinders.

item.title: Melbourne nutrition influencer died from postpartum haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears
item.description: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

item.title: CFS firefighter Peter Curtis's 'great courage' remembered at funeral service
item.description: Peter Curtis, who died at a bushfire ground on SA's Eyre Peninsula last month, has been remembered as a loving husband, father and grandfather, and a firefighter who "led from the front" and was a "bloody good bloke to have around".

item.title: Four more teenagers charged over stabbing at Ellenbrook Secondary College
item.description: A 10th teenager is charged over an alleged premeditated gang attack at Ellenbrook Secondary College on Monday that left a student with stab wounds.

item.title: Bathurst childcare worker sentenced after dragging and throwing child
item.description: A woman has been sentenced after pleading guilty to assaulting a three-year-old at a childcare centre in the NSW central west. The worker pleaded guilty to dragging and then throwing a child onto a mattress.

item.title: Stieglitz residents stay to defend homes amid bushfire near St Helens on Tasmania's east coast
item.description: As a bushfire rages on Tasmania's east coast, bayside resident Paul Worsteling shelters in his car, charging his phone while saltwater rains down on the roof.

item.title: From peacekeeping in Timor-Leste to PTSD in Afghanistan: The beauty and terror of being an official war artist
item.description: Australia has been sending artists to the frontline since World War I, with more than 50 local artists taking part since then. But what's it actually like to head into war armed with a paintbrush?

item.title: Bodycam vision shows initial police encounter with Luigi Mangione.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: To-do list, travel plans found during Luigi Mangione arrest revealed in court
item.description: A to-do list and travel plans shed light on the steps the 27-year-old may have taken — or planned to take — to avoid capture after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killing last year.

item.title: Alex Volkanovski hoses down retirement rumours ahead of first UFC title defence on Australian soil
item.description: Alex Volkanovski hoses down retirement rumours ahead of his first hometown fight in almost a decade with Australia's greatest ever UFC fighter aiming for another lengthy run defending the featherweight title.

item.title: WA opposition blames police staffing levels for slow response to Boulder ambulance emergency
item.description: The WA Liberals say a slow police response to a violent incident involving St John Ambulance officers in the Goldfields is due to understaffing but the claim has been rejected by the police minister.

item.title: Alexandar Rasic jailed for nine years over one-punch attack that killed Michael Hayes
item.description: Alexandar Rasic pleaded guilty to unlawful striking causing the death of Michael Hayes on the Gold Coast in June, 2023.

item.title: Tasmania's bushfire danger arrived suddenly. Here's how to prepare
item.description: Tasmania's bushfire season has suddenly arrived, with two catastrophes within days of each other. Here is how to prepare if one comes your way.

item.title: Children as young as 10 could be fitted with ankle monitors under proposed Queensland laws
item.description: The legislation removes the requirement for either the child, or their parent or guardian, to consent to wearing the device.

item.title: Defence briefs Pacific nations on China's naval flotilla but 'final destination' unknown
item.description: Australian Defence officials have been briefing Pacific nations about the formidable capabilities and weaponry of a Chinese naval flotilla in the region, which the ADF is continuing to monitor closely.

item.title: Man sentenced to six years' jail for series of high-speed chases in Canberra
item.description: A Canberra man has been sentenced to six years in jail after a string of high-speed police chases, including at extreme speeds on the wrong side of the road.

item.title: Caravan manufacturer Zone RV's $40 million creditor debt revealed after collapse
item.description: Zone RV plunged into administration last week, leaving customers, suppliers, employees and taxpayers in a $40 million hole.

item.title: Newcastle musician Taison Brockbank talks of flashbacks and pain after being set on fire
item.description: Newcastle rapper Taison Brockbank tells the court he nearly died after being set on fire during an attack in inner-city Newcastle in 2023.

item.title: Coroner finds police action 'inadequate' in lead-up to murder-suicide
item.description: Lynette Thompson was set on fire by her partner who later committed suicide. A coroner wants NSW police to change their procedures in dealing with domestic violence.

item.title: Woman found dead in NSW police station car park feared she was being stalked, father says
item.description: According to her father, Kirsten Moriarty had lodged a stalking report prior to her body being found in a car outside a NSW police station.

item.title: Retailer Bed Bath N' Table wins High Court case against competitor House
item.description: The stoush began in 2021 when the company House began opening new stores selling soft furnishings under the name House, Bed & Bath.

item.title: Halls Creek man arrested after allegedly selling $45k worth of alcohol in dry WA communities
item.description: The man allegedly bought large quantities of beer, champagne and rum in Darwin before selling it in WA's Kimberley region.

item.title: Teen's video diary on social media ban morning
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bail denied for 16-year-old accused of murdering Melbourne teenager Dau Akueng
item.description: A teen charged with the stabbing murder of a 15-year-old boy in Melbourne's west will remain in youth custody.

item.title: Victim statements redacted in 2014 fatal SA freeway crash court hearing
item.description: The daughters of a man who died in a truck crash at the bottom of the South-Eastern Freeway in 2014 have their heavily redacted victim impact statements read aloud in court, more than 11 years after their father died.

item.title: Hundreds of men march against domestic violence in Alice Springs on Human Rights Day
item.description: Up to 300 men — and a similar number of women — have taken part in the annual Ingkintja Men's March Against Domestic Violence under the slogan End the silence! Stop the violence! in Alice Springs, coinciding with the International Human Rights Day.

item.title: Age verification errors see some under-16s retain access to banned social media platforms
item.description: It's day one of the social media ban, but dozens of parents have told the ABC their children have already been able to get around the restrictions.

item.title: New order banning supply of NSW North Coast green prawns a 'death knell' for industry
item.description: White spot disease in prawns has led the NSW government to issue a new, five-year control order which will ban the sale of green prawns caught in affected waters.

item.title: New crocodile management plan draws mixed response in north Queensland
item.description: The new management plan sees the expansion of crocodile removal zones across north and far north Queensland. Some say it will not increase safety without better community education.

item.title: Man found guilty of raping 76yo woman at Coffs Harbour aged care facility
item.description: Judge Michael McHugh finds Hayden Carl Skinner guilty of sexually assaulting a woman after breaking into a Coffs Harbour aged care facility.

item.title: Police discover remains while investigating 2014 disappearance of Melbourne toddler
item.description: Detectives have discovered what appear to be human remains while investigating the disappearance of a Melbourne toddler 11 years ago.

item.title: Victorian Supreme Court judge says burning Charlie Gander's body was a 'horrible thing to do'
item.description: A Victorian Supreme Court judge says the destruction of 19-year-old Charlie Gander's body after his murder has added to the impact on his family.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: North Melbourne expect to land former number one AFLW draft pick Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner
item.description: North Melbourne have been unable to trade for Kristie-Lee Weston-Turner but the two-time defending AFLW premiers are still confident they'll secure the former number one draft pick.

item.title: Former specialist school worker strongly denies child sex abuse charges, court hears
item.description: The former staffer of a school for children with disabilities vigorously denies child sex abuse allegations, a court has heard.

item.title: Cambodia pulls team out of Thailand's Southeast Asian Games over border conflict
item.description: Cambodia withdraws its team from the Southeast Asian Games in Thailand for safety reasons, as a border conflict between the two neighbours rages for a third day.

item.title: Climate crisis is threatening disabled Australians' access to nature
item.description: From bushfires and decreasing air quality to flooding and erosion, climate change is threatening our relationship with nature, and people with disability are being disproportionately impacted.

item.title: At least 22 killed in collapse of two buildings in Morocco, state news agency says
item.description: The two adjacent four-storey buildings that collapsed overnight were home to eight families, the country's state news agency says.

item.title: Inquest into toddler's septic tank death sparks calls for improved maintenance in remote NT public housing
item.description: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

item.title: Kane Scott Dallow pleads guilty to forgery, fraud charges in Launceston Supreme Court
item.description: A convicted conman tells a court he was trying "to keep up an appearance" as he pleads guilty to forgery and fraud charges in a Tasmanian court.

item.title: Australia has recorded the highest number of Indigenous deaths in custody since 1979
item.description: Australia recorded the largest number of Indigenous deaths in custody in the last financial year since 1979. Experts say over-incarceration remains a national crisis and prisons are neglecting the physical and mental health of vulnerable people.

item.title: Marco Rubio orders US State Department to revert to Times New Roman font, calling Calibri adoption 'wasteful'
item.description: In a leaked internal cable, Secretary of State Marco Rubio calls the department's decision to adopt Calibri in 2023 a "wasteful" diversity move.

item.title: US backs Japan in dispute with China over radar incident as tensions escalate
item.description: China and Japan have given differing accounts of the incident, which was a major escalation in tensions between the two nations.

item.title: Nearly 200 children conceived from sperm donor with increased cancer risk
item.description: Between 2006 and 2022, the man's sperm was sold to 67 clinics in 14 countries, whereas 99 children were fathered by the donor in Denmark alone.

item.title: US plans to order foreign tourists, including Australians, to disclose social media histories
item.description: Applicants would also have to submit phone numbers, email addresses, personal details of family members and biometric information under the plan.

item.title: Half a million people flee Thailand-Cambodia border conflict as Trump moves to intervene again
item.description: Thailand has rejected Donald Trump's plan to call both sides to achieve peace, with half a million people forced to flee the fighting along the border.

item.title: Sophie Kinsella, author of the best-selling Shopaholic novels, dies at 55
item.description: Kinsella, who also published under her real name, Madeleine Wickham, announced in April 2024 that she had been diagnosed in late 2022 with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer.

item.title: Democracies must fight for freedom, Nobel Peace Prize laureate Machado says
item.description: Democracies must be prepared to fight for freedom in order to survive, Nobel Peace Prize laureate and Venezuelan opposition leader Maria Corina Machado says in a speech delivered by her daughter.

item.title: Two-way tolls with $60 permanent cap confirmed for Sydney's harbour bridge and tunnel
item.description: Drivers are set to be tolled on all three Sydney Harbour crossings in 2028, but a weekly toll cap will be made permanent, the NSW government confirms.

item.title: Tens of thousands of VCE students to receive ATAR as results released
item.description: The nail-biting wait is over for tens of thousands of Victorian year 12 students, who will begin receiving their much-anticipated VCE results online from 7am today.

item.title: Today in History, December 11: How a van full of armed men and millions of dollars inspired Goodfellas
item.description: It has been almost 50 years since armed men burst into the Lufthansa cargo terminal at New York's John F Kennedy International Airport and got away with stealing millions.

item.title: Formula 1 quiz: How much do you remember from the 2025 season?
item.description: After 24 grand prix and plenty of champagne, the Formula 1 2025 World Championship is over. But between all the races and rivalries, points and penalties — how much do you remember?

item.title: Landmark case aims to force betting agencies to return gambled stolen millions
item.description: A landmark legal case against three of Australia's biggest online betting agencies has been filed in the Federal Court, aimed at recovering millions of dollars' worth of stolen money that was gambled away and kept by corporate bookmakers.

item.title: Meta ran ads for bond scheme run by GIM Trading that allegedly defrauded millions from investors
item.description: Tech giant Meta ran advertisements used to lure Australian investors into a fraudulent bond scheme that allegedly defrauded tens of millions of dollars from them.

item.title: Nationals MP's high family travel bill highlights generous rules
item.description: Calls for politicians' family travel entitlements to be tightened are growing, as analysis shows one Nationals MP was allowed to charge taxpayers more than $80,000 flying his spouse to and from Canberra 27 times in two years.
